page.title:
HEASARC
HEASARC
page.normal_text:
Provides access to all the publically available X- and gamma-ray datasets. Also many general catalogs and datasets held at other data centers (eg Chandra and XMM-Newton).
Provides access to all the publically available X- and gamma-ray
datasets. Also many general catalogs and datasets held at other data
centers (eg Chandra and XMM-Newton).

Powerful search engine (Browse) with a uniform interface across missions.
Powerful search engine (Browse) with a uniform interface across
missions.

Batch processing and cross-correlation capabilities.
Batch processing and cross-correlation capabilities.

Includes bibliographic links to datasets where available.
Includes bibliographic links to datasets where available.

If you haven’t used browse before read the introduction at heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/W3Browse/w3browse-help.html
If you haven’t used browse before read the introduction at
heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/W3Browse/w3browse-help.html

X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
Chandra Data Archive
Chandra Data Archive
page.normal_text:
Provides access to all the Chandra datasets using an interface tailored for Chandra (http://asc.harvard.edu/cda).
Provides access to all the Chandra datasets using an interface
tailored for Chandra (http://asc.harvard.edu/cda). t a i l o r e d
f o r
C h a n d r a
( h t t p : / / a s c . h a r v a r d . e d u / c d a ) .

ChaSeR (java) and WebChaSeR (web page) provide search and retrieval of datasets.
ChaSeR (java) and WebChaSeR (web page) provide search and
retrieval of datasets.

Chandra Fast Image is a simplified interface intended for the general public but can also be used to get quick looks at data before deciding whether to download it.
Chandra Fast Image is a simplified interface intended for the
general public but can also be used to get quick looks at data
before deciding whether to download it.

Bibliography search for Chandra papers on a given object or observation.
Bibliography search for Chandra papers on a given object or
observation.

X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
XMM Science Archive
XMM Science Archive
page.normal_text:
Java-based interface provides access to all XMM-Newton datasets.
Java-based interface provides access to all XMM-Newton
datasets.

Many XMM-specific search options including on attributes in the EPIC source catalog.
Many XMM-specific search options including on attributes in
the EPIC source catalog.

Optical images from the source ID program.
Optical images from the source ID program.

New users should take the guided tour at http://xmm.esac.esa.int/external/xmm_data_acc/xsa/docs/tour.shtml
New users should take the guided tour at
http://xmm.esac.esa.int/external/xmm_data_acc/xsa/docs/tour.shtml

X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
Mirror sites
Mirror sites
page.normal_text:
Several sites mirror some datasets. You should use these if you are physically located near them.
Several sites mirror some datasets. You should use these if you
are physically located near them.

LEDAS at Leicester University in the UK has mirrors of the Chandra, ASCA, ROSAT archives and the XMM source catalog (http://ledas-www.star.le.ac.uk).
LEDAS at Leicester University in the UK has mirrors of the
Chandra, ASCA, ROSAT archives and the XMM source catalog
(http://ledas-www.star.le.ac.uk).

DARTS at ISAS in Japan has several archival datasets including a mirror of the ROSAT All-sky survey (http://darts.isas.jaxa.jp).
DARTS at ISAS in Japan has several archival datasets including
a mirror of the ROSAT All-sky survey (http://darts.isas.jaxa.jp).

ASDC in Italy has BeppoSAX, ASCA, and ROSAT datasets (http://www.asdc.asi.it).
ASDC in Italy has BeppoSAX, ASCA, and ROSAT datasets
(http://www.asdc.asi.it).

X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
CALDB
CALDB
page.normal_text:
One of the problems in X-ray astronomy is the large number of files that are usually required to store all the calibration information for an instrument. Keeping track of these and making these available to the data analysis software is challenging.
One of the problems in X-ray astronomy is the large number of
files that are usually required to store all the calibration
information for an instrument. Keeping track of these and
making these available to the data analysis software is
challenging.

The CALDB is a directory structure and indexing system for FITS files which enables software to read the correct calibration data without needing to know the filename or directory.
The CALDB is a directory structure and indexing system for
FITS files which enables software to read the correct calibration
data without needing to know the filename or directory.

Users can either install a CALDB locally or for occasional use access the calibration files from the HEASARC site.
Users can either install a CALDB locally or for occasional use
access the calibration files from the HEASARC site.

CALDB is used for HEASARC archival and current missions and for Chandra but not (alas) for XMM.
CALDB is used for HEASARC archival and current missions
and for Chandra but not (alas) for XMM.

X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
Software packages
Software packages
page.normal_text:
HEAsoft - heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/docs/software/lheasoft
HEAsoft - heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/docs/software/lheasoft H E A s o f t - h e a s a r c . g s f c . n a s a . g o v / d o c s / s o f t w a r e / l h e a s o f t

CIAO - asc.harvard.edu/ciao
CIAO - asc.harvard.edu/ciao C I A O - a s c . h a r v a r d . e d u / c i a o

SAS - xmm.vilspa.esa.es/external/xmm_sw_cal/sas_frame.shtml
SAS - xmm.vilspa.esa.es/external/xmm_sw_cal/sas_frame.shtml S A S - x m m . v i l s p a . e s a . e s / e x t e r n a l / x m m _ s w _ c a l / s a s _ f r a m e . s h t m l

All these packages operate on FITS files with standard formats defined for each type of dataset. We have attempted to make it possible to mix and match tools from different packages.
All these packages operate on FITS files with standard formats
defined for each type of dataset. We have attempted to make it
possible to mix and match tools from different packages.

X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
HEAsoft
HEAsoft
page.normal_text:
Large and diverse package distributed by NASA Goddard.
Large and diverse package distributed by NASA Goddard.

Latest release is 6.3.1. Runs under Linux, Solaris, OS-X, and Cygwin.
Latest release is 6.3.1. Runs under Linux, Solaris, OS-X, and
Cygwin.

Can be downloaded as either source code or binaries. The latter is usually adequate unless you want to apply source patches.
Can be downloaded as either source code or binaries. The latter is
usually adequate unless you want to apply source patches.

Contains generic multi-mission tools as well as packages for current missions RXTE, Swift, Suzaku and a number of archival missions.
Contains generic multi-mission tools as well as packages for
current missions RXTE, Swift, Suzaku and a number of archival
missions.

For help : heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/cgi-bin/ftoolshelp
For help : heasarc.gsfc.nasa.gov/cgi-bin/ftoolshelp

X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007

page.title:
HEAsoft components
HEAsoft components
page.normal_text:
X-ray Astronomy School 2007
X-ray Astronomy School 2007
page.enlisting:
• XANADU - High-level, multi-mission tasks for X-ray astronomical spectral, timing, and imaging data analysis • FTOOLS - General and mission-specific tools for FITS files • FITSIO - Core library responsible for reading/writing FITS files • fv - General FITS file browser/editor/plotter with a graphical user interface (distributed with FTOOLS) • XSTAR - Tool for calculating the physical conditions and emission spectra of photo-ionized gases • PROFIT - Visualizing and modelling high-resolution spectra. • XANADU - High-level, multi-mission tasks for X-ray astronomical spectral, timing, and imaging data analysis • FTOOLS - General and mission-specific tools for FITS files • FITSIO - Core library responsible for reading/writing FITS files • fv - General FITS file browser/editor/plotter with a graphical user interface (distributed with FTOOLS) • XSTAR - Tool for calculating the physical conditions and emission spectra of photo-ionized gases
